intro: Mikania bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá Mikania, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. It has a fibrous root system and can form dense mats when established. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
